attributes.action: Fathers should not pay CSA if they don´t have access to their child
attributes.background: Mothers who claim CSA and do not let fathers see their child shouldn't be allowed to do so. A parent can´t have the best of both worlds claiming CSA and deny the other parent access, its not fair and its not right.
attributes.additional_details: I understand some cases are different i.e the other parent is dangerous for the child to stay with. In these cases CSA should still be available.

attributes.action: Ban drinking alcohol in Parliament by MP's
attributes.background: Alcohol at work is not allowed as it is unsafe and people can make decisions that when they were sober they may consider what they did was inappropriate.  So why when the interest of the UK is being debated and voted on by MP's are they allowed to be under the influence of alcohol.

attributes.action: Create a national database to check who has a current DBS certificate.
attributes.background: I believe there is a massive loophole, which potential allows paedophiles and other inappropriate adults access to the most vulnerable in our society. As parents/guardians we no right to check DBS certificates are in place. Neither the Charity Commission or the DBS check they have been done.
attributes.additional_details: I had reason to ask for confirmation that DBS certificates were in place at a charity my sister attends (she is a vulnerable adult). They refused, their response to my request was to threaten to report me to the Police for harassment. The charity is now being investigated by SAFA - Hertfordshire Police unit responsible for 'Safeguarding Adults from Abuse'due to serious Safeguarding issues.

attributes.action: Abandon plans to force companies to 'list foreign workers'
attributes.background: The Government has announced that it wants to force companies in the UK to list how many foreign workers they employ, with the purpose being to 'name and shame' employers who do not employ enough British workers. This highly Xenophobic policy is demeans the country we live in and should be withdrawn
attributes.additional_details:
Immigrants are human beings and they do not deserve to be treated unequally. If the government presses forwards with this policy it will open the door to yet more hatred and division in British society, and push us close to the kinds of policies widespread in Europe in the 1930s

-- 

Quote in the Petition title taken from the Times front page, 05/10/16

attributes.action: Make it law that all ice rinks make you wear crash helmets and elbow protection.
attributes.background:
As a child growing up going ice skating i never wore crash helmets or elbow protection. 
As a adult taking my own children I have not made them either wear protection whilst Ice Skating, but when they go doughnutting they do wear crash helmets Recently i suffered a head injury ice skating.
attributes.additional_details:
I fell smashed my head on the Ice and have been suffering server concussion for 3 weeks and still recovering,So the last 3 weeks my 4 children , grandma and my husband all have to look after me as I have not been able to do anything . 

Please read about concussion and sign the petition keep all our children and parents safe . Thank you for your time

attributes.action: Change the standards for disabled travelling on all public transport.
attributes.background: At the moment most companies comply with the set standards for disabled travellers. But this isn't enough, one wheelchair space per bus or train often leaves disabled people waiting at station because the designated spot is full. There need to be more than one space. The bare minimum isn't enough.
attributes.additional_details: My brother is in a wheelchair he has often been left waiting for up to an hour because the space he needed was full. Also other people are left behind be he is in the space etc.

attributes.action: Change the law on sexual abuse in a position of trust to include sports clubs
attributes.background: I was concerned to find that the Sexual Offences Act 2003 doesn't include sports clubs as one of the settings in which the Act’s provisions on ‘abuse of position of trust’ apply. At the moment, the law doesn't protect 16 and 17 year olds from sexual harassment and abuse in sports clubs.

attributes.action: Regulate the use of all plastics in the UK. Through a license system.
attributes.background: Many uses of plastics are unnecessary and irresponsible, the regulation should include packaging. All plastics Produced in the UK or Imported should require a license. Necessary use such as Medical and certain foods are acceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
All plastic bags should be banned other than those used for hygiene purposes and waste disposal, which should be clear, transparent bags.
This will reduce the need for recycling and lower pollution. It will also mean a responsible approach to the use of resources.

attributes.action: Make the Home Office settlement application process fair, transparent and smooth
attributes.background: The Home Office charge average of £2000 for each settlment application which takes up to 6 months for standard applicaiton outside the UK. The settlment processing times unfailry vary, affecting a lot of British families and make them live their life apart waiting for Home office deicision.
attributes.additional_details:
The home office currently charge very high fees for settment process submitted out of the U.K and make the process unfair and unnessarily very lengthy.

If you pay additionaly £450 you can get the application considrered in 3 weeks instead of 6 months. Other countries in Europe process the applications fairly, quickly and accurately reliable on integrity of the applicaiotn rather thatn purely on fees paid. 

On top of the applicaiton fee, you have to pay for health insurance additionaly - even if you are covered by international health insurance. 

In many cases, Home Office makes plain wrong immigration decisions  , which makes life for these families unbearable , having to wait about 1 to 2 years to solve their appeals through the courts to rectify the wrong decisions.

attributes.action: Reduce the foreign aid contribution from 0.7% to 0.2% GDP
attributes.background: In the current climate of government cuts to our Local authorities, NHS and social funding (specifically OAP) it is completely unacceptable to be sending approximately 12 billion pounds of UK tax payers money out of the country when our own services are failing.

attributes.action: Increase fines and ban cyclists from the road who jump red lights.
attributes.background:
It seems to becoming more apparent that cyclists in London and more recently Manchester are failing to stop at red lights, risking serious injuries to pedestrians.

The problem has also been increased by delivery companies using cyclists to deliver goods and failing to stop at red lights.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the Institute of Advanced Motorists, 57% of cyclists admit to running red lights. A 2013 YouGov poll found that 35% of cyclists admit to ignoring red lights at least “occasionally.”

If caught jumping a red light, cyclists can be issued a Fixed Penalty Notice of £30.

The Law is unfair. A motorist jumping a light,  will lead to a Fixed Penalty Notice of 3 points and £100 fine.

The same Law should  apply to cyclists who should also carry third party insurance as a minimum.

attributes.action: Ban the use of black plastic in single use packaging.
attributes.background: Many councils do not accept black plastic in recycling schemes because it is very difficult to recycle, and can contaminate the recycling process. We suggest that the use of black plastic in single use packaging is banned.

attributes.action: Compel energy providers to offer the cheapest tariffs on pre-pay meters.
attributes.background: Users of pre-pay meters are unfairly disadvantaged when purchasing energy to heat their homes. Although often on lower incomes they actually have to pay a higher rate. This is "fuel poverty" - higher tariffs result in people going without food or other essentials as they just try to keep warm.
attributes.additional_details: Guardian article https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2017/jan/19/fuel-poverty-heating-disabled-cold-penalised-energy-tariff

attributes.action: Make all motorway matrix signs read Keep Left Unless Overtaking when not in use
attributes.background: Middle-lane-sitting is a common problem for many motorway users, and often results on excessive overtaking speed, undertaking, road rage and congestion. I think this problem is largely caused by ignorance of proper road use and could be eased by instructing drivers to keep left using overhead signs.
attributes.additional_details: As stated in the Highway Code (goo.gl/zagJKH) road users should keep left on the motorway and move back to the left as soon as they have overtaken, however for many drivers it has been years since they learned this rule. The result of this is poor road use resulting in heavy congestion and frustration for others. The overhead announcement boards could easily be used, when not displaying live notices, to say "Keep Left Unless Overtaking" to remind road users of how to use the motorways properly.

attributes.action: Make the law clear that any child who assists in for profit work is employed
attributes.background: Thousands of children, many of them younger than 13 in the UK, are working in commercial research, testing, marketing and consultancy. See http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/uknews/4308213/Thousands-of-children-being-paid-to-market-products-to-schoolmates.html
attributes.additional_details: The Children and Young Persons Act 1933 prohibits children younger than 13 being used to assist in for-profit work such as that described above. However, problems with enforcing this law have caused many to turn a blind eye to this. The result is many children are being exploited –have no workers’ rights, are deprived of pay and can end up doing work such as for-profit clinical testing that is unsafe for them, and so the law needs to be made clearer to ensure this does not happen.

attributes.action: GPs to be reviewed and retrained each time misdiagnosis of cancer
attributes.background: My son was misdiagnosed three times by GPs which lead to stage three. As they are the first point of call they need to spot this early and listen to parents. This happens too many times and no one is reviewed.
attributes.additional_details: I know of three cases, myself, two friends. All GPs incorrect medical knowledge of cancer.

attributes.action: “To require the Government to repeal Section 40 of the Crime and Courts Act 2013
attributes.background: The majority of British Newspapers want nothing to do with 'Impress' as an 'independent regulator'; because the Freedom of the Press is a rare and treasured commodity.
attributes.additional_details: I refer to the excellent article written by Mr. Fraser Nelson in the Telegraph

attributes.action: Education funding should be ring fenced pupils funded equally.
attributes.background: Changes announced today (14 December) in the way schools will be funded in the future is just robbing Peter to pay Paul. Children are our future and they should be educated equally whenever they live.
attributes.additional_details: Schools are oversubscribed in some areas and others undersubscribed however equal funding would  hopefully address this problem and enable heads to allocate funding according to the needs of their pupils.

attributes.action: Provide anonymity for those accused of sexual assault until they're found guilty
attributes.background: While we find complete sympathy with all men and women who have been raped, the anonymity provided to the accusers must be extended to the accused until a verdict is reached. Careers are easily destroyed on allegations alone - even when the accused is found innocent. The imbalance is unjustifiable.
attributes.additional_details: In many circumstances in the past careers and livelihoods have been ruined by such allegations - even when the accused were eventually found innocent in a court of law. For many of the same reasons that the accusers are granted anonymity, we should extend this to accused to allow them protection from public scrutiny until they are found guilty.

attributes.action: Make Helium Balloons Illegal
attributes.background: I am always seeing helium balloons. Helium is a limited resource so should not be used for balloons, especially as helium can be used for important MRI scanners. This gas is lighter than air and will never be seen again if it floats away. So please support me in my hope to ban helium balloons.
attributes.additional_details:
When pressure becomes too much for a balloon it will pop, and the foil balloon will land in the ocean- a innocent sea creature will eat it and die.
Helium is a limited resource and is needed for MRI scanners to work. Helium is the only element out of all 118 in the periodic table that can cool the electromagnets to the right temperature for the scanner to work. One day helium may save your life.

attributes.action: Campaign for greater involvement of the UK in the refugee resettlement
attributes.background: The reason for this petition is because we believe that the UK isn't allowing the enough number of refugees into the UK. Also we should be allowed to be part of the decision of allowing refugees in or not because at the end of the day it is the public who put decision makers in power.
attributes.additional_details: As we have put the decision makers in power they need to understand that without us they wouldn't be in power and also the reason they are in power is so that our voice can be heard.

attributes.action: Compulsory teaching of media bias in secondary education
attributes.background: Everyday we are fed information from the media, be it TV, newspapers, news sites, billboards, etc. The media needs money, and so they will do what they need to do to be financially viable, going as far as inciting hate. Compulsory teaching of media bias may help people make more informed choices.

attributes.action: Remove Toll On Queen Elizabeth the 2nd Tunnel if in traffic longer than 30mins
attributes.background: I cross this bridge everyday and I have had enough like many others paying £2.50 and upwards to be stuck in traffic for hours

attributes.action: Reinstate legal aid for students and people on a low income
attributes.background: Many people need the help of solicitors and courts all around the UK for various reasons but can't afford the costs by themselves. The 1st of April 2013 saw legal aid was discontinued. This petition will see that people are able to receive help in many cases that legal aid covered.
attributes.additional_details:
When legal aid was discontinued this meant some types of case were no longer eligible for public funds - including divorce, child contact, welfare benefits, employment, clinical negligence, and housing law except in very limited circumstances. (BBC news) 
This petition should be looked into by Houses of Parliament and even if only a few were reinstated for legal aid such as child contact being the main issue as every parent and child should be together and some parents can't afford legal costs.

attributes.action: Fund the NHS by increasing income-tax by 2 pence in the pound.
attributes.background: The NHS is on its knees, it requires reorganisation which means a lot more funding than is currently available from the Government purses.  We ALL benefit from the NHS and we CANNOT allow it to fall 'unfit for purpose'. "Once it has gone - there will be no turning back"
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS should be free service to all UK citizens and that is true in most cases however, 'nothing is free in life'. If we want to be able to visit a doctor when we feel ill or go to Casualty, when our child or other loved one has suffered a serious injury or perhaps receive cancer treatment or other medical care - maybe we need to call an ambulance in an emergency, we need to keep and fund the NHS.

To keep this service the NHS has to be paid for!!!

Working people could pay 2 pence in the pound  & those of us receiving State benefits & pensions to have 2% deducted at source.

 I want my grandchildren to be able to have access to a good NHS but we must all do our bit to pay for. 

Please sign this petition to help us achieve it.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to require disclosure of current  salary on a job application
attributes.background: Candidates are often dismissed as unsuitable if their current salary is more than 10% removed from the salary of the role they are applying for.  This discourages career advancement as well as job mobility between industries with different pay grades.  Candidates should be assessed on merit alone.
attributes.additional_details: Employers use current salary as a baseline to make an offer to a successful candidate, leading to a situation where two candidates can be paid vastly different amounts for the same role – this discourages social mobility and gender equality by ensuring that employees who are paid less than their colleagues are unable to catch up even when moving jobs.   Candidates can also fail to be considered for a role if their current salary is not in the same range as the role they are applying for.

attributes.action: Ban all forms of Cold Calling In All Areas Of The UK
attributes.background: We the people of the United Kingdom would like to petition the UK Government to place a ban on all forms of cold calling in all areas of the UK (England, Scotland, Wales, Northern Ireland).
attributes.additional_details:
People across the UK regularly receive cold calls through a number of methods... door to door, telephone etc from sales, PPi and many more. It is believed that a lot of people find this to be anti social and crime related to cold calling would appear to be on the rise, especially with the elderly, people with mental health issues and people at risk.

Door to door cold calling can be unsettling & telephone cold calling can be a nuisance as opt out services such as TPS don't seem to work.

attributes.action: Nationalise Utility companies and regenerate UK infrastructure with the profits.
attributes.background: The privatised utility companies run a virtual monopoly with an arcane pricing structure designed to confuse. There was no evidence of significantly more inefficiency when they were previously in public ownership and unlike transport we all rely absolutely on utility companies for our wellbeing.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that given the option the majority of people in the UK would support a return to public ownership,  regardless of political persuasion. If necessary this might be an option for the larger metropolitan areas to run as pilot schemes initially , with a local poll conducted independently of any political party.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for a service provider to have a premium rate phone number.
attributes.background: Make it illegal for service providers to have a premium rate phone number so contacting them regarding their services is of great personal cost. This should cover, delivery companies, all house hold bills and any shops that you need to contact for any reason relating to a goods or service bought.

attributes.action: Retain local anaesthesia, prior to donation, for those blood donors who need it.
attributes.background:
Donating blood is, generally, pain-free but for some it can be very painful.  Anaesthesia is available for those donors who need it but
from April 2017 it will no longer be available.  

In my own case, I was advised never to give blood without anaesthetic after an incident at a donor session.
attributes.additional_details:
Blood & Transplant make the point that their Donor Carers have excellent needle skills and that B&T have developed various distraction and coping techniques to enable donors to donate without anaesthesia.
For those who simply have a fear of needles, this is an excellent step forward.  For those whose anatomy makes donation a complicated, prolonged and painful experience such techniques will be of little use.
The withdrawal of Lidocaine will only save the NHS about £30,000 per year

attributes.action: Create abandoned buildings suitable for the homeless
attributes.background: To many people are living on the streets, we have so many abandoned buildings that arnt being used at all we need to open these buildings for the homeless, free of charge or affordable for them.

attributes.action: Reduce income tax for people who are earning under £43,000 from 20% to 15%.
attributes.background: People all over the United Kingdom work very hard for their money that they earn, and are being taxed way too much. If 5% was reduced from the general tax rate, employees would be much happier with their jobs. Unemployed people will be more likely to work as the salary rates will be more appealing.

attributes.action: Allow GCSE students to have a formula sheet in their physics exam
attributes.background: Allow GCSE students to have a formula sheet in their physics exam as doing an exam using formulas is about how well you can use them and rearrange them, not whether their memory remembers all of them, this will help the students in their exams and allow them to revise more important things.

attributes.action: Let the speaker speak! A motion of the House in support of the Speaker.
attributes.background: On the 06th February the Speaker of the House of Commons spoke up to voice the views of many that President Trump not be allowed to address the House. Now he faces a no confidence motion.This petition seeks support for the debate of a counter motion of support for his position.Don't gag the Speaker!
attributes.additional_details: James Duddridge MP has sought to attack the Speaker. Over 1 million people signed a petition objecting to Trump's State visit and furthermore there is disquiet across the House regarding it. The Speaker must maintain order and preserve the dignity of the House. He was accordingly obliged to intervene when the Prime Minister elected to offer a State visit to such a divisive figure who sows discord and disorder.Let the Speaker Speak.

attributes.action: Make Videos on social media of minors being bullied a criminal offence
attributes.background: I am outraged at the amount of youngsters under the age of 16 commiting suicide due to bullying. Social media is not helping with the growing amount of videos posted of young people being hit/kicked/spat on/humiliated, while being recorded then posted on the Internet for all to see.

attributes.action: Abolish Stamp Duty on Main Home
attributes.background: People need to move house for many reasons, job, health, family, personal circumstances change etc. they should be able to move easily, without a financial penalty being paid to the government. But they can't because of stamp duty. It locks people in unsuitable homes and restricts movement.
attributes.additional_details: Most have to add the stamp duty tax to their mortgage. How can taking out a loan for 25-30 years to pay the government for the privilege of moving home be right. Stamp duty tax is damaging the property market, peoples lives & the economy. Many people that want to, or need to move cannot, simply because of the enormous cost of stamp duty. Stamp Duty tax needs to be abolished.

attributes.action: Urge the US president to apologise for humiliating Johnson Beharry VC
attributes.background:
The PM should make direct representations to POTUS and demand a public apology be made to HMQEII.

Johnson Beharry VC was delayed entry to the US after the POTUS ordered travel restrictions on 27 January 2017. He missed a veterans' event where he was due to be a guest of honour.
attributes.additional_details:
Johnson Beharry VC is a member of the British Army who won the UK's highest military honour for bravery in Iraq in 2004. He suffered significant injury in doing so. He described he "felt humiliated" during recent experience at JFK Airport.

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/donald-trump-muslim-ban-johnson-beharry-victoria-cross-humiliated-a7563451.html

http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/johnson-beharry-victoria-cross-war-hero-humiliated-donald-trump-travel-ban_uk_58970829e4b0768562164564

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-4192774/Victoria-Cross-war-hero-Johnson-Beharry-humiliated-US-border-officials.html

http://www.standard.co.uk/news/world/victoria-cross-hero-johnson-beharry-humiliated-after-being-caught-up-in-donald-trumps-travel-ban-a3458696.html

attributes.action: Stop taxing overtime, to allow us an opportunity to better ourselves.
attributes.background: No one wants to be at work let alone staying on and working additional hours let's be fair! I appreciate the taxing system and fully respect paying into it from our basic wage , when I choose to work overtime I believe it should be mine not the tax man's as my bit paid from my basic is sufficient.

attributes.action: Make Manston airport UK air freight port, Gatwick & Heathrow passenger airports
attributes.background: The former Manston  RAF airstrip has an existing runway capable of use by largest  air freight planes. Thanet has good infrastructure, close to  ports of Dover & Ramsgate. Transferring all air freight  to Manston would eliminate need for third runway at Gatwick or Heathrow & improve air quality .
attributes.additional_details:
Surrounded on 2 sides by sea & closer to Europe and China than Gatwick or Heathrow. Air freight at Manston would reduce the millions of freight lorries passing through the port of Dover where infrastructure is very poor. Encourage development at the ports of Ramsgate and Tilbury make a new Thames crossing more financially viable 
Reduce high air pollution levels in Dover & Southeast
The population of Thanet & UKIP led council want an airport at Manston and need the employment opportunity.

attributes.action: Make physical education take place every day during school for one hour
attributes.background: In the UK Obesity is on the rise and its something that can be controlled.We the people of the UK need to take action and quickly.A majority of people do not take part in regular exercise each day.we require at least one hours exercise each day and may find it hard to make time for exercise daily
attributes.additional_details: Obesity has risen for men has risen from 22% up to 30% since the year 2000 that's over a quarter of the United Kingdom's male population that is obese

attributes.action: All Taxi drivers licensed to Halton have free travel across the Mersey Gateway
attributes.background: Currently all Halton residents Using a Taxi will have to pay £4.00 per crossing only to get back £2.00 per crossing this is putting us out of pocket as we where promised the crossing free of charge by David Cameron and George Osborne.
attributes.additional_details: This fee that Halton residents will have to pay will leave them out of pocket because we don't drive. There are also NHS resources that need Taxis to ferry blood to Whiston Hosptial and other NHS sites in the area. Also George Osbourne and both David Cameron have made promises http://www.merseygateway.co.uk/2014/07/chancellor-of-the-exchequer-george-osborne-announces-free-trips-across-both-silver-jubilee-and-mersey-gateway-bridges-for-all-halton-residents/

attributes.action: Introduce a new law to ensure all vehicles have a dash cam installed.
attributes.background:
This will serve as a very good form of evidence, in cases of poor driving on our roads, including undertaking at speed, use of cellphones whilst driving, road rage incidents, drink driving.
I have had several cases of experiencing drivers using cellphones whilst in control of their vehicles.
attributes.additional_details: I have been able to provide, evidence of anti social behaviour to the Police who have been able to take further action deemed necessary.

attributes.action: Change law to require LA's to provide 15 min free parking in all LA parking bays
attributes.background: Often drivers feel they have received a parking ticket for staying only a few seconds over their designated period. There a distrust between drivers and local authorities, drivers believing that they are being penalised by Councils raising parking fees to cover other council spending.
attributes.additional_details: In 2013 LAs made £635 million surplus from parking revenue.

attributes.action: Heavier prison scentences for pedophiles and rapists.
attributes.background: I firmly believe that the scentences handed out to pedophiles and rapists are far to lenient.When someone commits a crime against a child or rapes a person they are as good as murdering who that person once was
attributes.additional_details: Anyone who has been raped or abused will tell you they will never be the same again...in essence the person they once were is now dead...children who are abused have their childhood stolen from them..the perpetrators of such unspeakble acts deserve to be punished severly and the victims at the very least deserve the justice that harsher scentences would bring

attributes.action: Consider a vote of No Confidence in Jeremy Hunt, Secretary of state for Health
attributes.background: The Independent exposes the collusion of Jeremy Hunt,  Department of Health and the HEE  to impose junior doctor contracts. Health Education England is meant to be an INDEPENDENT body  responsible for the teaching and training of health care staff. Mr Hunt cannot be trusted with future of our NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
6th January 2017 article in the Independent 
Emails show Jeremy Hunt’s Department of Health 'colluded' with ‘independent’ body to impose junior doctor contracts
Emails seen by The Independent reveal collaboration with Health Education England, which provides NHS trusts with £3.65bn of funding every year

attributes.action: NHS Charges for non National insurance payers
attributes.background: This issue is important because the NHS needs help and people that do not pay into the national insurance program should be asked to pay for their treatment received, We as tax payers all have NI Numbers
attributes.additional_details: My suggestion is that when we are first seen in A&E we are asked for our NI card as proof that we are entitled to free treatment, If we cannot provide this then we are asked how we are going to pay either Credit card or insurance documents. Just like checking into a hotel the card is swiped at first contact. On completion of treatment the card on insurance company are charged at the going rate of charges, This will help prevent the strain on NHS resources, and bring us in line with other countries

attributes.action: Ban pheasant shooting - a cruel, senseless 'sport'.
attributes.background: Living in the countryside, we sadly witness repeated pheasant shoots taking place right before our eyes. Despite what they say, the pheasants more often than not die in a slow, painful manner often landing in our garden whilst still alive, in agony, dying slowly.This so-called 'sport' needs to stop.
attributes.additional_details:
Repeated pheasant shoots take place across the UK, but I am speaking from personal experience of it happening in North Lincolnshire, more often than not without any prior notice given.

The pheasants are bred, released into the surrounding area, then shot repeatedly by people who enjoy killing animals for fun.

The pheasants are often mauled while still alive by dogs and/or write in agony as they land on the ground.

This is inhumane and needs to be stopped as soon as possible.

attributes.action: Set up of a Men's Equality committee to address issues like male rape & suicide.
attributes.background:
There is already a Women & Equalities Committee, but it has not yet done any inquiries into issues facing men, such as; 
1* Suicide (three times as high in men) 
2* Male rape (where services for men are insufficient) 
3* Domestic violence against men (misreported as only affecting women).
attributes.additional_details:
1. suicide rates by gender 16.8 per 100,000 for men and 5.2 per 100,000 for women from Samaritans website http://www.samaritans.org/about-us/our-research/facts-and-figures-about-suicide 
2. 85,000 women and 12,000 men raped per year. http://rapecrisis.org.uk/statistics.php
3. 1 in 4 women and 1 in 6 men - http://www.lwa.org.uk/understanding-abuse/statistics.htm”

attributes.action: Urge UN deployment of observers for safe evacuation of civilians and rebels
attributes.background: The Syrian Regime has failed to allow safe passage for besieged civilians and rebels to leave Aleppo and has resumed shelling. Thousands risk being massacred. The UK Government must support and urge the UN to deploy International Observers to facilitate the evacuation of all civilians and rebels.
attributes.additional_details:
As of the 14th of December 2016, France's Foreign Minister has called for the deployment of UN observers, but this has not been raised to the UN, nor does it stipulate safety for all civilians and militants. 

"What France demands is the presence of observers of the United Nations on the ground to have a guarantee that the evacuation, which is a priority for the civilians, [takes place], but also so that militants are not massacred," (Jean-Marc Ayrault - quoted by Les Echos newspaper).

attributes.action: Compulsory cardiac screenings (once every 6 months) for those who do any sport.
attributes.background: Some people have have died whilst part taking in sports, such as Robin Chard aged 48 who died of cardiac arrest whilst cycling to raise money for a cancer charity.
attributes.additional_details: These are only a few examples listed, but if we had routine cardiac screenings these incidents would have been caught earlier and treatment would have been provided.
